meanings.definition: Causing a toxic reaction when exposed to light.
meanings.sent1: The phototoxic chemicals in the sunscreen can harm your skin when you go out in the sun.
meanings.sent2: It is important to be aware of phototoxic plants that can cause skin irritation when touched and exposed to sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The phototoxic lotion decided to have a light-hearted competition with the sun, but it didn't end well.
meanings.sent4: The phototoxic effect of the medication on his skin was like a fiery reaction to sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The phototoxic reaction on her skin glowed like a warning sign under the sun's rays.

meanings.definition: A substance that becomes toxic when exposed to light.
meanings.sent1: She carefully stored the phototoxic chemical in a dark container to prevent any accidental exposure to light.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying the effects of phototoxic substances on marine life due to increased exposure to sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The phototoxic compound was known to throw a party whenever it saw sunlight, causing chaos in the lab.
meanings.sent4: The phototoxic material transformed into a dangerous element under the bright light, surprising the researchers.
meanings.sent5: The phototoxic substance's reaction to light was like a hidden danger waiting to be revealed.
